description:
Hear me out everyone.

As a disclaimer, I do NOT eat at Charley's every day. The idea of eating an additive-filled, greasy, heart-stopping, artery-clogging sandwich for lunch every day does not sound healthy. Quite the opposite.

I typically bring a healthy, home-cooked lunch into work every day. However on the occasional Friday I will treat myself to a small original cheesesteak from Charley's. 

The sandwich is so delicious. I crave one every so often when I want to indulge in something so fattening but delicious. The bread is toasted yet warm and soft, the steak is flavorful and thin, the peppers are onions are cooked well, and the lettuce and tomato combined with the mayo and the juice from the meat is heavenly. The first bite is always the best one. I only order a small, otherwise I will feel guilty about eating a large sandwich that's so bad for you.

Is this unhealthy? Yes
Is it inside the mall food court? Yes
Will it cause acne breakouts and short-term digestion issues? Probably
Is it delicious and worth it? Hell yeah

This is my guilty pleasure and I encourage you to make it yours as well. 
Long live Charley's!
author: Taylor M.

description: The Chicken California sub was pretty good. Much better than Subway.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Agreeing with other reviews, there are so many other good choices at the Westfield Food Court that it feels weird to choose something like this for your meal.

There's decent subs and there's sad subs. Disappointingly, these fall under the sad subs because of how they come out--soggy, falling apart, and leaving you in a state of "Where is the meat on this sub?" For the price I paid, it is a bit disappointing when there are Subways around where I could have had a slightly-less sad sub.

Learning my lesson from this, maybe this place isn't for me. If you're in the mood for subs, Subway will give a better bang for your buck and at least you can see them fill it up so you can complain if they're being frugal with the ingredients. I'll be sticking to the other locations in the food court.
author: Renneth D.

description:
My friend and I came to the Westfield Foodcourt to look for food, and ended up coming here. I got the Italian Deluxe sandwich combo and it ended up being quite mediocre. At about $6 for a small sized- sandwich, I expect something a bit better than what I can get at Subway for a footlong. Instead I got what was essentially just a more oil/fatty version of Subway's Italian BMT.

The fries were quite mediocre as well, and the lemonade was too sweet in parts, and not lemon-y enough. The whole meal overall was a let down, and I doubt I would be coming back, given all the other options available in the immediate vicinity.
author: Tyler T.

description: Th philly cheese steak (no 7) is a mouthwatering eat. Great to grab for a quick lunch stop on the go while exploring the mall. Delicious.
author: Leanne P.

description:
I tried this place a while back and was not too impressed. However, I have a relative in town and we gave this place a try and honestly, it's a lot better than before!

They also have a worker handing out samples now and that's what promoted us to try this place. 

If you are planing to share between two people, order the large; it's a good deal. We had Chicken Cheddar Sandwich. It looked pretty and tasted pretty good. My only complain is it's a bit too salty. We also had fries and they were fresh out the frier. 

All in all, a pretty average eatery in the mall. With eateries closing left and right at this mall, I hope it will stay open!
author: Alice L.

description:
I live nearby a Charley's Grilled Subs, but it was my first time giving their subs a try.
The Westfield Shopping Center in San Francisco doesn't carry the usual food court spots, but cater to more mom n pop' smaller food stands. There wasn't many vegetarian options, and with the adrenaline rush of the crowds, I wasn't as hungry as I had hoped. My boyfriend settled on Charley's since he's tried it on multiple occasions. He ordered an Italian sub with French fries, and last minute- I found a veggie delite! Which, ended up being my order.

The Veggie Delite was a sub with mushrooms, onions, cheese, lettuce , and tomato. The sandwich was toasted and very reminiscent to the Firehouse Subs sandwich, of the same ingredients. I ordered a small, with their lemonade, and a side of original French fries. If you love cheese fries, Charley's is very generous with their cheese, but I will admit it's nothing I would try again.
The sandwich was cooked to perfection, and their bread was served open flat, in case any topping were to be added- or , in case you wanted to remove something easily. :)
It was a cool delivery and made it easier to enjoy too!
The line wasn't long when we dropped by, but everyone flocked towards it within minutes of lunch time beginning.  We received our food within 7 minutes, no more than that, but mind you- we were the first in line too! 
The food court is busy and there isn't a lot of seating, but thankfully we received our food quickly enough so we had more time to look.
The food court is very humid, but it could be due to the population, or lack of A/C so it would be my best advice to take your food to go and eat at the local park! 

Overall, Charley's was an awesome,filling, sandwich which is perfect if you are planning to venture around the city on foot and looking for a hot sub to keep your energy up!
author: Fran R.

description: Solid sub but not amazing. They were handing out samples and that got me in. Ordered a philly, bacon sandwich and cheese fries - couldn't say no. I'd give the cheese fries a 4 too because the thick fries had nacho-like melted cheese. The sandwich was fine with a modest level of meat. I think a higher ratio of meat or a kind of special sauce could go a long way for the sandwich.
author: Young Y.

description:
My sister and I came for a early weekday lunch, so it wasn't very crowded down here in the bowels of the food court. This place is tucked away in a back corner.

I didn't feel like yet another cheesesteak, so I opted for the pepperoni steak. I also took the combo deal which added fries and a drink (I wanted to try their lemonade).

It appeared that we were the second customers of the day. Our ticket said #1, so I assume the couple ahead of us was #0. Our food arrived pretty quickly, but they almost forgot my drink when they handed me my tray of food.

I would say the food here is solid mall food but nothing special. Nothing blew my socks off, but nothing impressed me either. The pepperoni added more flavor to the steak, I would probably order it again. I liked that they had a ketchup dispenser so I didn't need to resort to piles of packets. But I wish that the sandwich had more meat in it. I can say that I really liked their lemonade though.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
We actually went into San Francisco Centre for cookies until a friend and I realized we hadn't eaten all day. Roaming around the Food Court, another friend and I decided to split a sandwich from Charley's Grilled Subs. We stopped by on Friday, September 2nd at 4pm.

*Philly cheesesteak: steak, grilled onions, green peppers, mushrooms & white american ($8.99 regular)
*Cheese fries: cheddar cheese sauce ($3.49)
*Bottled water ($1.79 ea) ×2

I decided to add cheese fries at the last minute because I love them. This was actually the best part of our meal. I love ooey gooey cheese. I just wish there was more of it as some fries didn't even have cheese on them. The fries themselves were crispy and the ones without cheese, I dunked in ketchup. The sandwich itself was just meh. The meat was bland and didn't have any grill flavor. (I actually wondered if it was cooked on a grilled.) I didn't eat the bread, but for a food court offering, the meat ratio was average. I liked how the veggies added a little crunch, but there really wasn't anything super tasty about this sandwich. It basically just fed me since I was hungry.

Disappointing cheese steaks. Maybe opt for something else like their nacho fries and get a sandwich elsewhere.
author: Elena N.

description: Very bad customers service's I was in the line for 20 minutes and we I got to the cashier she told me we don't expect cards, I looked around and i asked her where is the sign that say we only expect cash, she said no sign. I told her you have this employee handing sample She could have said we Don't except cards, passing out  to the customers. On professional customer service
author: Bakil F.

description:
If you are coming here for the cheesesteak, you are not ordering correctly at Charleys. You come to Charleys for a Chicken California and fries. The first time I got hooked was when Charleys cleverly placed an employee with samples right near the counter. It was so dang good. The sample was the Chicken California sans veggies. 

I've had cheesesteaks in SF, and the best place to get them is from a food truck called Izzy's Cheesesteaks. It is the closest thing to an authentic Philly cheesesteak. 

The Chicken California has chicken, provolone and ranch. When you order, you can also add veggies like lettuce and tomatoes. 

The service is ok, really depends on when you go. The rate at which food comes out is always really, really slow. Once you order, grab a seat, it will take awhile.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
With other options available this place would be my last choice for foods after experiencing the service today. 

Being yelled at instead of asking what size of sandwich do I want,  should had been a warning, and not knowing what type of soda, with only 6 choices to choose from, should had deterred me from placing the order. I would have expect something like this if I was ordering at McDonald where I pay $5 for burger but if I am paying $15 for a sandwich, you would expect better service. And of course they would charge $.50 for mayonnaise. 

I understand most of these places cater to customers who are out of town and probably never eat in the same place twice. However, for those who do live in the city and work in the neighborhood and visit the center often do frequent these shops. More than likely, these group of people would never visit the same place again if the service is horrible. Unless the restaurants start to cater to both groups, longevity of the restaurant will be short. 

With that said probably would given the foods 4 stars, if I wasn't deterred by the service, and probably would visit again.
author: Zach P.

description: Unfriendly servers.  If I ask for it to go, shouldn't you ask if I need a bag, even if it cost 10 cents?!?  And not rudely say 10 cents when I pick up my food and ask for a bag.
author: Christina C.

description:
My friend and I came to the mall to run some errands, and needed to stop for "fuel" before we got started.  Charley's looked like just the ticket :-)

The look and the delicious smell of the sandwiches got my attention immediately; I'd never eaten here before and I liked the idea of trying something different.  I ordered the combo meal with a Philly cheese steak. Fortunately, they let me order it without the onion or mushroom since I'm not overly fond of either. 

I thought the food was pretty good!  My cheese steak was delicious. It wasn't anything like crazy spectacular but it satisfied both my hunger and my taste buds.  I really did love the fries though. I got the combo that adds cheese and bacon to the fries and I really enjoyed that.

The service wasn't the best, but those amazing fries and that delicious sandwich more than made up for it - I think I just found a new go-to sub place.  :-)
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Every time I see Charley's, I pretty much think of Great Steak. Same concept, different items on the menu.

Pros:
- Located in the food court of Westfield.
- Fairly simple menu that consists of subs, sandwiches, fries, lemonades, and combos
- Since it's in the foodcourt, there are loads of available seating nearby
- Fast service
- Different kinds of fries (regular, waffle, sweet potato, gourmet fries) 

Cons:
- Very lackluster in flavor, don't expect super gourmet food, especially since it's in the foodcourt of a shopping mall.
- Pretty pricey for the subs
- They're not so generous with the portions of toppings on the subs.
- Presentation of a typical Philly cheesesteak is kinda messy. 

It's not super amazing food, but it does keep you full and gets you going through the day.
author: Jerianne G.

description: I really wish these west coast cheese steak places would just get on with it and do it Philly style, Whiz wit' or Whiz witout.  Provolone is fine but Cheese Whiz is the real deal.  The cheese fries were only ok, better with the bacon bits on top.  Line moved fast at 11am on a Sunday morning.  Try the blueberry lemonade for a sweet, refreshing finish.
author: Joc V.

description: So Charley's has to charge 50 cents just for extra mayo on the side??  How petty can you get??  Sorry but this joint gets 1 star from me.  Last time coming here.
author: R B.

description:
#00672. The employees take one piece of Provolone cheese and 1/2 the mushroom sauce for themselves. Half the Regular Philly Cheese Steak is OK and the other 1/2 is dry and the meat has been sitting out.

Hint: more is being sold here than the sandwich.

No thanks.
author: William L G.

description:
I know mall court food isn't suppose to be spectacular but dammmnnn. Literally the cheapest place to EVER buy a cheesesteak sandwich from. Subway would give you more meat on a 5" than this place give you on a 9". 

And the freaking service. Ordered a meal and waited 20mins. Turns out they forgot my order. Waited another 5 mins for my food then they forgot I ordered a meal. Grabbed some fries on the counter and some random drink near the soda machine (it was a coke and I ordered a DrPepper). When I asked for a change to my proper drink, they tasted my soda to ensure I wasn't lying (the cup was 98% full aside from my taste sip). 

My food came out looking pathetic. Even McDonalds came closer to their picture in terms of actual product. Never again will I eat here.
author: AQ N.

description: I dont know why it has such a bad rating, I really liked it. I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak: Super fast and friendly service. The bread was a lil bit soggy and the meat was quite bland but combined with the cheese it tasted quite good. The fries tasted good as well and was crispy. The best thing imo was the strawberry lemonade. Imo u should give it a try its neither expensive nor cheap.
author: Duy-Nam B.

description: Got a small chicken philly cheese sandwich from here for a late night snack. Flavor was good, and tasted like subway level quality. Didn't expect much and tasted fine for food court food. Chicken wasn't too dry or undercooked and good ratio of bread, vegetables, and meat.
author: Edward W.

description:
I love Charley's. I visit them at any & every mall I go to. It's my first pick. This 1 was very disappointing. Not only did I stand in line for over 3 minutes waiting on someone to take my order, I had to ask the girl that was handing out samples if anyone was taking orders. 
These people don't even ask you what kind of topping you want on your phillies. I had to ask 3 different ppl to put jalapeños on my Philly before someone understand me. They also hire a lot of Asian ppl that barely understand English. The food isn't bad. Outside of them making my bun soggy & it ripping apart.
I almost forgot to add that they charged me for a bag that my food didn't even fit in. Ridiculous
author: Antoinette S.

description: The subs are great don't get me wrong - it's the pricing which I feel is a little steep for a basic sub. A small 6in veggie is 6.50 plus a drink came out to almost $11. There are plenty of other options around the food court that are better, in terms of price portion and quality - in my opinion
author: Brenda L.

description:
After trying pretty much everything else at the Westfield Food Court, I finally got around to trying Charley's. I really appreciate a good cheesesteak, and I thought that Charley's might offer a fancy cheesesteak since everything else at the food court is fancy and expensive. 

Sadly, I was wrong. On the bright side, while it wasn't fancy, it wasn't expensive either.  The service was very fast. I waited about 3 minutes from the time I got in line to the time I had my cheesesteak in hand.  Unfortunately, the meat was dry and bland, and the filling was very skimpy. The cheesesteak was served open faced, which is really strange for a cheesesteak, and the cheese was not spread evenly - it was mostly in the center, as if they just scooped it over the roll. The bread was nothing special - just a plain soft white roll, not at all like a proper Amoroso roll used at proper Philly cheesesteak shops. That being said, the cheesesteak tasted OK, but I doubt I'd ever eat here again. 

Next time I feel like having a cheesesteak, I'll head over to the Cheesesteak Shop on Divisadero or Buster's in North Beach
author: Allen T.

description:
This review is for their gourmet fries. 

Sigh, what a disappointment. I got lured in by a sample of their California club, but wasn't hungry enough for a sandwich. Then I saw an ad for the gourmet fries (3.49) and decided to give it a try! Sadly, I'm not sure if real potatoes were used since the texture was really off. I like my fries crispy and light, but these were dense and mushy. Only saving grace was the bacon, which was sparse. Would not recommend.
author: Melissa T.

description:
When I am at the mall here.  That is my favor food place.  So much food.  And taste great. 

Love that place
author: Ford T.

description:
I was a former employee here for over a year. So, this is about as honest a review you're going to get. This is like the McDonalds of sub sandwiches. Honestly, the meat is always cooked to be pretty dry. The fries are adequate.  The lemonade is alright, but pretty sweet. So, good to ask to mix with some more water. 

Best times to go:
10AM-1:30PM
4PM-9PM(weekdays) 
If you want it speedy and good quality. This is when they're least busy and can take their time. When it gets too busy and there are many orders; the manager tells us to speed up and leads to many mistakes. 

DO NOT BOTHER WITH PHONE ORDERS. Seriously, it's going to be annoying for both the employees and you. 9/10 we just wait till the customer comes and then cook the food. 

The prices are also more expensive than other Charley's. The rent for the store is high. Also with every increase in minimum wage the prices raise to compensate. 

In terms of ordering. These are items that I still enjoy after working there. 
Lemonade (All)
Pepperoni Steak
Turkey Cheddar Melt
Fries (Regular)
BBQ Cheddar Steak
author: Andrew S.

description:
Pretty sure the food I got here made me sick. 

I got an order of ultimate fries and now feel queasy and nauseous. No Bueno.

Pass.
author: Yanni L.

description: I don't know why restaurants open if they suck at their food and portions. Just had the worst philly. Paid $12 to get a philly with no flavor. It's supposed to come with mushrooms. But it didn't. I asked the cook where's the mushrooms? He said somewhere in there lol. Never coming back. Don't waste your money.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description:
Charley's is located in the back corner of the downstairs food court of WestField. 2 shops down from Soup Company and Loving Hut. They also give free samples of their subs. How can you miss free samples? ;)

Wait time is about 15-20 minutes. Don't know why it takes so long. 

I normally get the Combo because it comes with fries. Around $6.51 tax included.
The 2 subs I've had were pretty good. I've had the Chicken Cheesesteak and Chicken California. Honestly, they taste about the same but I really liked it. It's flavorful but a little on the salty side. Chicken meat isn't dry. Hint of cheese. 

I LOVE Charley's Fries. Only because of the seasoning they provide on the side that you can sprinkle. I seriously COAT my fries under that seasoning. So bad but so good. I've also tried the Ultimate Fries (which consists of fries, ranch, bacon pieces, cheddar). It was... decent.. Though the cheddar had a weird taste, not cheesy or nacho like. Nothing special. I would save my money and just go for the regular fries and top it with the seasoning.
author: Benita M.

description:
Wasn't too excited about the Philly cheese steak. The flavor is bland. They put lettuce on it even though I asked for no lettuce. Who the hell puts lettuce on a Philly anyway? 
It's super crowded too.
author: Sergio L.

description: I hadn't eaten all day and having looked around the food court decided I needed something substantial so ordered a Reg Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich and Cheese Fries $13.50 (no drink). The staff are not rude, but certainly couldn't be described as friendly.... but, I wasn't there to make friends. As for the food......The sandwich tasted synthetic and the beef didn't taste like it had been grilled. If they consider the solidified yellow gluep they put on the fries as authentic tasting cheese fries then they need to go back to cookery school. Saying that I ate most of the meal as I was really hungry, but I consider this as filling my stomach rather than an enjoyable dining experience. I left feeling as though I had put something really quite unhealthy inside my body and regret my visit.
author: Joseph L.

description: This is the first time I've eaten at any of the food court of Westfield mall. I ordered a medium chicken philly with tomatoes, minus the lettuce. Bread was soft. Meat was moist. What's not to like? Meat, melted cheese, yum!
author: Dirty S.

description: Think sub the steak they do is one of the best I ever tried and I would return just for that.
author: Anabella P.

description:
More like 3.5 stars, but rounding up to be nice.

This is my go-to spot for food at the Westfield Mall. The subs always hit the spot. I almost always get the same thing, a chicken buffalo sub. Flavor never disappoints and the service is on point...fast, friendly, and clean. However, the actual quality of the food varies...somedays my sub is so soggy that I feel like I need a spoon to eat it. It gets so messy. But can't have it all I guess.
author: Wanda M.

description:
Meh... that pretty much sizes up Charley's to me. Jamie W. is always in the mood for a good cheesesteak sandwich. We found one in North Beach in a place called Buster's. It's one guy with a sharp spatula at a hot grill. Charley's takes a village to make one sandwich. The assembly line approach means no one owns the ultimate vision of my sandwich, and that's the level of commitment that's missing in this operation. Instead, you see a busy crew of ennui-filled teens in their matching red T-shirts and black aprons each responsible for some component of the sandwich moving down the line. 

Both of us ordered the $8.99 Large Philly Steak Deluxe which adds grilled onions and green peppers, mushrooms, provolone, tomato slices and shredded lettuce to the thin strips of steak inserted in a hoagie bun (see photo). It was little different from a creation you could get at Subway where you can at least control the ingredients being inserted in your sandwich with disposable plastic gloves. Strangely, it came in a bowl. We also had a $2.49 cup of the Original Fries (see photo). It all struck us as expensive considering it's just fast food. Finding a seat in the food court was another chore with all the family units getting very territorial with their fortress of trays. 

FOOD - 2 stars...assembly-line sub...where is the love? 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it's s food court for Pete's sake 
SERVICE - 2 stars...I'm just a number 
TOTAL - 2 stars...pass...we'll be taking the bus to Buster's next time
author: Ed U.

description: This is my 1st time ever eating a large size sub Philly Cheesesteak w/ Cheese Fries at Charley's Grilled Subs at the Westfield of San Francisco... Reason why, I wanted to eat the large size was because, I didn't eat any breakfast at all!!! And so when I ordered myself the large size Philly Cheesesteak... I have to say it was okay the steak was cooked okay and the steak was soft and tender for my first time eating it... But someday I gotta try the birth place of the Cheesesteak which is at Philadelphia, PA!!! After reading some of the other yelp reviews of this cheesesteak sandwich place some of the yelpers have said that they didn't like the cheesesteak sandwich that much... But for me on my first time eating it I didn't have problems with the Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich!!!
author: William B.

description: As they handed me their strawberry lemonade it dropped, and I asked for a replacement. The manager said I must PAY for a new drink. WTF? I used to eat here frequently, but needless to say, I'm never coming here again.
author: Erica C.

description: Customer service and food are always good. Tasty subs awesome fries and all served with a smile. Every time I come to San Francisco this is my spot before being a tourist. Enjoy
author: Pradeep D.

description: I would have to say one of the best cheese steaks ive had. Really hit the spot and didn't have to wait long very recommended!
author: Oscar L.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend when we were just feeling a little bit nibbly and wanted a small bite to eat.

Atmosphere:
Located at the Westfield Food Emporium, I feel like Charley's Subs doesn't really belong next to things like tri-tip steak from Buckhorn Grill and delicious and filling meals from other restaurants too. Charley's Grilled Subs is more similar to the mall food at every other boring shopping mall in the world - not the amazing food court I'm used to for Westfield.

Customer Service:
Actually pretty good. The food came out at reasonable times and the cashier was quite friendly.

Food:
I ordered the Buffalo Chicken sandwich and the Buffalo & Bleu Cheese fries. Unfortunately, I thought their buffalo sauce wasn't the best quality... tasted very watered down in fact. The sandwich was alright, nothing amazingly special but nothing too bad either. I do have a bone to pick with the fries though - they aren't that great and aren't as "gourmet" as advertised - just alright fries with watered down buffalo sauce.

---

Overall, Charley's Grilled Subs is probably a solid 2 stars. Decent food at decent prices, but I wouldn't come back with any cravings.
author: Clarissa Y.

description: Would NOT recommend for vegetarians. Their "veggie" is almost all cheese, ton of peppers and almost no mushrooms. Pathetic sandwich for over $6. Go elsewhere
author: Dee K.

description:
I enjoyed my Philly cheese steak, and fries. But I think the best part was the peach lemonade.  It had REAL diced peaches at the bottom.  Delicious. 

The food is good enough, but not great.  But this is a chain, so you shouldn't expect high-end fact dining.  But it gets the job done, and relatively cheap. Boom!!
author: Drake B.

description: Given the poor reviews already here, I feel like I should come here a couple more times before reviewing, but I won't. This place is so goooood! Try the chicken California. This is the one they hand out as samples all the time so it must be what they think is best. All it is is chicken, provolone, ranch and lettuce and tomatoes, if you want. Nothing special at all, but some how this sandwich is amazing. It must be their bread and the ranch. Probably the ranch. That being said, a small (5"?) sub is a whopping 440 calories. I wasn't even aware there was such thing as an unhealthy chicken sandwich.
author: Patricia K.

description: I have been going to Charleys for years,as they are common on most Air Force food courts. However I had been avoiding them and most chain eateries in SF. Decided to give Charleys a try couple of weeks ago--BAM so good. Super Delicious figure it may be a fluke so I have been back twice since each time just confirmed the flavor and taste. Philly Cheese extra meat,bacon cheddar fries have been flawless each time. Now we all know chains can be hit or miss,but this ones a hit.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Just because it's mall food, doesn't mean I can't hate on it like a bad meal from a traditional restaurant.  Having actually had decent cheesesteaks in San Francisco, like Theo's, I was predisposed to testing out Charley's for a quick pre-movie bite.   Clearly, Charley should get some advice from Theo!

Philly Cheesesteak:  Had to get the signature dish in its pure form for a proper benchmark.  I knew better than to get the lettuce, tomato, green peppers and mayo.  However, I did add-on jalapeños to simulate hots and some pickles because I like pickles.  Was rather disappointed that they used sliced cheese when the Cheez Whiz like substance was obviously available for the cheese fries.  I found the roll not chewy enough and definitely had too high of a bread-to-meat ratio.  The cheese was segmented on the top most portion of the meat, thus bypassing the typical melted throughout sensation.  This cheese misalignment also made  the meat feel dry.  Was unimpressed overall.

Fries: Smaller than a steak fry, but thicker than McDonald's.  Could have been crunchier.  Definitely wasn't enticing enough to have me gorging.
author: Adam B.

description:
I had a large chicken philly ($10) and was pretty disappointed. It wasn't packed with flavor like Great Steak does it. It was flavorless.

I made it a meal (fries and drink for $3 more) and the amount of fries that it came with was sad. I could have held all the fries in the palm of my hand.

I upgraded my drink to a peach lemonade for $1 more. It was the only thing in my meal that I enjoyed. I would be back only for their lemonade.
author: Andy W.

description:
It is a decent place to get a melted sub with cheese and meat. I was just a tad bit disappointed at the non-thoroughly toasted bread, but ah well, I've never gotten good toasty bread in this area for cheesesteak subs anyway.

The regular looked small but if you get all the fixins' on it, it ends up being a pretty decent-sized sandwich for an average stomach. If you get the gourmet fries it's definitely a good meal. Not super cheap -- but decent enough, and will get you overdosing on cheese.

The lemonade was also good too. It's definitely not too shabby for a high end mall food court.
author: Alice C.

description:
Nestled in the corner of the Westfield Mall's food court, this sandwich chain serves a variety of Philly Cheesesteak sandwiches and comfort foods.  This location originally housed David's Cookies and later a gourmet hot dog vendor before morphing into this brightly lit stand.  My friend wanted to try this as a change of pace from the regular spots (Sorabol, Firewood, and Andale).  I tried the Philly Steak deluxe which includes green pepper, grilled onions, and mushrooms (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jM6AUHoTEVIeZ6P8WXUDhw?select=XRL8qsFa27MBJL4TC9cM7g).  The green pepper's flavor was dominant in this sandwich.  We shared the cheddar and bacon fries (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jM6AUHoTEVIeZ6P8WXUDhw?select=bCXCzivLomE_88t1MzjofA), which were just okay as the fries were on the soft side.  The lemonade was tastily sweet, more of a lemon drink than 'ade.  They emphasize that their bread is freshly baked and that the chain was born in Columbus, Ohio near the local university.  
With the diminishing Quizno's locations, it's nice to have a hot sandwich choice downtown.  However, don't compare this to Ike's or Deli Board, because it is still a chain store.
author: Mike C.

description: I have to go to class directly after I get out of work two days per week, so a lot of times I don't come prepared with dinner and am forced to eat in the Westfield shopping center.  I have gone to Charlie's a few times because everything else in the shopping center is Asian food (there's a vegan Asian place, a Thai place, a Korean place, three Japanese places and a panda express, so if you want extremely sweet, sugary, stirfried oily noodles, you have options galore) and all the other food vendors (except for Buckhorn) are horrible so the first time I went to Charley's, I ordered from the cashier, her name is Mary Rose, she's always working when I'm at Westfield, and when I presented her with my student ID card, that gets me a 10% discount at all of the mall food court restaurants, she said they don't give a discount for students, they only give a discount for employees of the mall. So I asked her to check with the boss because SFSU tells night students to be sure to get an ID card so that they can get the crappy mall food for a little bit cheaper somce we r there at dinner time. So in front of me she asks, very unenthusiastically, her boss whether they give a student discount and her boss answers her before she can even finish the word discount and he says "yes we do,10%" she looked embarrassed, apologized and gave us the discount.  The following time, when I parented the student discount card again, she said "we don't give student discounts, we only give a discount for employees, but I'll just do that for you this one time." I was about to remind her that she had verified the student discount policy in front of me the last time I was there, but just decided to leave well enough alone and just say thanks.  So tonight I went back and when I went up to the counter she was standing a few feet away sweeping. She looked up at me and said "...YYEEESSS???" So I said "oh are you closed?" And she said ".....no?" then just stared at me. I decided that I was done with her weird attitude and haggling over a 10% discount so I just went somewhere else. I won't be returning. Oh but if u do go, definitely ask for no mayo. Trust.  Also, I think you are supposed to order by approaching the counter and before getting any recognition you should just shout the food items you want in the general direction of the cashier. Not sure though.
author: Emma H.

description:
better than subway for sure but I am not sure this is a go to for me. No real complaints per say but nothing spectacular. I dont eat sandwiches or subs frequently so when I do I want a great one. Though there is no reason not to eat this food. 

The fries were crispy and good.
author: Kristan B.

description:
Ordered a regular Buffalo Chicken Sandwich along with Bacon & Cheddar fries. It really tastes good and the bacon flavor really makes the fries awesome. The sandwich is alright. Nothing spectacular. The fries actually saved this from being a 2 star as I had to wait almost 20 minutes or so for my order to come out.

I really hope they clear up the mess while trying to get orders out to people. There was probably about 10-15 people waiting for their orders while I was waiting for mine too.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Keep in mind this is the first low review I have ever written and I have had some very subpar to mediocre service and have never been motivated to write about it in this way. Let me tell you about our experience here.

So my lady friend was thirsty and although it was busy, she decided to order a blueberry lemonade. We ordered at approximately 3:04. Okay, simple enough. After seeing people on people gather waiting for their food, we just decided that they were really busy and waited for it. It wasn't until about 25 minutes later, I kid you not. 25 minutes later, that they realized that our drink had not been made.

When the drink was finally made, it was made in about less than a minute, which is respectable. The man at the cashier promptly apologized for taking so long but he did not actually know what drink we ordered and gave me the wrong drink. I showed him the receipt and he promptly made the drink again, this time without any ice. He gave me some fries for free which I respect him trying to make up for his mistake. I brought the drink to my lady friend who was now very upset that it had taken half an hour. When I came back to get a cup of ice, the man told me they were low on ice. I told him the drink you had just given me after half an hour had no ice. He gave me a look as if I was the one who was in the wrong. He gave me a scoop of ice about as big as a 6 oz cup and most of it was water. 

Overall.
-Incredibly slow service
-Mix of apologetic/Non-caring staff
-30 minute wait for a drink
-Forgot our order
-Wrong drink 
-Right drink with no ice

+Free fries


Oh and you guys made my lady friend cry. So, that will never be okay in my eyes.
I'll be sure to never come back and always tell people not to as well.

Have as a nice day to whoever reads this
author: Royal B.

description: Been here a couple of times. Never really impressed with the customer service.  Food is mediocre.  First time there I was on lunch break, ordered a philly cheesesteak,fries and a drink.Considering there was nobody ahead of me I thought the process should be relatively fast. Nope. I told the cashier it was for to go. The gal that put my order together was putting it on a tray, I told her I believed that was my order and that I was taking it to go. She said are you sure? I'm pretty certain I'm not eating here. She repeated my order to me, then went to ask the cashier if it was for here or to go?! If I'm m telling you it's take out then it's take out! Tweedle Dee and tweedle dumb get going back and forth. The whole process took about 15 minutes! Half my break. Thanks. Never again.
author: michelle r.

description:
The service I received was really bad 
They seem to be to concerned about how many people they need to serve then actually helping them . 
I went for my lunch break, the line was already long  and the workers seem to don't know how to go ahead and organized themselves 
They have 3 grill man two cashiers one yelling out the order and two prepping 
I worked in a fast pace restaurant so I know what busy is, they weren't 
Too make it this long story short 
They were annoyed they has to take my order over the phone then I told them I'll be there in 10 min (I work in the mall )
And when I got there they just started my order it's ridiculous that people put the excuse that they are to busy too provide some good customer service
author: Rebeca Z.

description: Got the Italian Deluxe and a lemonade. The Italian Deluxe was a good size and tasted good. The lemonade was excellent, would recommend!
author: Conor M.

description:
First time eating at a Charley's Sub and most likely the last. 

I ordered the turkey melt combo, small. Asked for everything except for pickles and peppers. What did I get? Pickles and peppers. I was in a hurry and I only had a few minutes so I decided not to say anything and just pick them out. I do give them props for having a pretty substantial "small" size sub. I was definitely full after that and the fries. My sub however was bland. I honestly didn't want to finish it, but I needed sustenance because I still had half a day of school left. The lemonade was okay. I took three sips and just left it. 

Maybe I got the wrong sandwich? Idk but nothing was memorable enough for me to give them another try.
author: Abigail D.

description: When they said $3.49 more to make it a combo, I thought it included the drink. No it was just this fries, and its not good :(
author: J L.

description:
For fast food, it is a little pricy. I paid about $10 for smalls fries and a bbq meat cheese sandwich. The taste was okay. the meat was at room tempt, but the fries were nicely crisped 

the food came out quickly and theres ample seating space (dependin on what day/time youre at the mall)
author: Connie M.

description: OMG, this place is soo good! I ate here for the first time Jan 1st, and have been back many times. There sandwiches are fairly priced and are good quantity.  There menu is simple but if your craving a good sandwich and fries, this place wont disappoint.  The bacon 3 cheese steak is really good.  Also, there lemonade is amazing.  Definitely check them out.
author: B C.

description:
I don't often write a 1 star review, but when I do it's because someone really screws up...

My wife sent me to Charley's today for some Cheese fries.  I decided to surprise her with a chicken sandwich in addition to her fries.  I said "I'd like a chicken sub with mushrooms and Mayo, and French Fries with extra cheese on the side"  The guy even asked me if I want 2 cups of cheese or 4 for the fries.  There wasn't much of a line so I felt I'd be in and out quickly.  I guess I didn't realize that there were 20 orders that needed to cook before mine and got my food 25 minutes after ordering.  At this point I head out, battling my way through the perfume counter people at Bloomingdales and drive home.  When I handed my wife her dinner she asked where the cheese fries were... The numbskull behind the counter gave me cheese fries with extra cheese - AND NO FRIES.  Now, I'm in the dog house and my poor wife is hungry.  I am boycotting this place!
author: Josh F.

description:
Came here after a little shopping. Small line, food looked good, thought it'd be the best place for a quick bite. 

Ordered a turkey cheddar melt with a strawberry lemonade. Then the wait started. My wife left me right before I ordered and decided on Korean instead. More than double the line, her food was done and she was already eating... And my number wasn't close to being up.  Food court eateries with a full kitchen shouldn't be this slow. 

When I finally got my food, it was so-so. Probably would have tasted better if I wasn't so annoyed with the wait. 

The only redeeming value of this place, and what earned them 2 stars was the strawberry lemonade. Very tasty, chunks of strawberries, a tad sweet but it hit the spot.

Much better places to choose from at the Westfield!
author: Jon H.

description: Normal mall food. I had a sub with everything on it, it was pretty good with slices of meat and blue cheese. The service wasn't as bad as other people have mentioned. I mean, who can go wrong with cheesesteaks?
author: Kristy K.

description:
Ordered a chicken Philly something or other. Asked for nothing on it but the basics. Grilled onions and peppers. Got a sandwich with next to no meat, tomatos, lettuce and mayo. No onion. No pepper. 

I am actually kind of shocked they gave me chicken.
author: Patrick M.

description: Was searching for a place to eat in the Westfield Mall after watching a movie over at the Metreon. Wanted a sandwich and ordered the chicken teriyaki sub. I have never eaten here before. I thought the sandwich was tasty and the price was reasonable for a small ($6.95). I didn't have the lemonade or fries so I can't tell you how they taste. But,  the sandwiches are good - no different from Jimmy Johns or Subway - you can't go wrong.
author: Debi L.

description: I got the Turkey Cheddar Melt which was pretty good. They offer steak fries which aren't really my fave. But everything was hot & pretty good. Also, thanks to the sweet dude for giving me a 10% mall employee discount even though I'm not. ;)
author: Amy C.

description: The food is just not that great. I had a small California Chicken, which comes with chicken, ranch sauce, lettuce and tomato, and the ultimate fries (with cheese sauce, bacon and ranch). Neither were very good. Next time I will try something else.
author: Rick G.

description: So they're not gourmet, but Charley's is still a tasty sandwich and good value.
author: Jess C.

description:
Charley's bright exterior caught my attention right away, I could tell it's newly opened. The menu looked appetizing and I like that it had the calorie count listed next to each item. Compared to most of other places in the mall, this one was relatively inexpensive which is a plus.

 I love that there were samples to to try and the one I tried just came out so the flavors of the meat and cheese satisfied my taste buds. The sample girl was very friendly as I went for seconds haha.

I ordered the regular Chicken California with the gourmet combo (toppings on fries+drink). Gourmet combo added $4.69 to my sandwich. My friend ordered the large Philly Steak Deluxe and a kiwi lemonade. I guess I came at a less busy time so my order came pretty quickly. The sandwich was pretty good - made with grilled chicken and melt provolone cheese, ranch dressing, though I think I should've asked for extra meat cuz I think it would've filled out the bun more. The bread itself was delicious with a good crunch. I tried a bite of the deluxe which came with grilled steak, green peppers, mushrooms, and onions. It was okay pretty good and compared to mine had way more meat. Oh the fries. Cheese and bacon. They are to die for. The lemonade was a bit too sweet for my taste so I added a bit of water to dilute it and it tasted refreshing! The kiwi one was alright. 

From the previous reviews, seems like they had some bad experiences with the customer service, guess it depends on whos serving your food at the time cuz the guy the served ours was pretty nice and chill.

Would come again if I'm looking for some relatively cheap food in the mall.
author: Anna L.

description:
It looks like a Charley's sandwich but it doesn't taste like one. Everything is wrong. Meat was tough. Bread was not crunchy on the outside soft on inside. Mayonnaise was funky. 
The fries were good but they don't give you the same amount as other outposts.
I love Charley's. I ride the subway all the way to Penn just for one of there delicious sandwiches. This is not Charley's. It is also really expensive. In NY the same meal, only edible, including subway fare is still 2 dollars less.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Friends and I came here for a quick lunch during Pride, and we were surprised how quick they were taking and filling orders. The menu isn't extensive, but it does offer some really interesting combinations. I also really appreciate that they offer quite a few toppings you can add to your burger FOR FREE! I got the Bacon 3 Cheesesteak and fries. My sub was alright... the bacon was nice and crisp and all three cheeses were present in flavor, but the meat itself was kind of bland. Nice and juicy, but lacking real flavor. The fries were perfect though!

My main gripe is that this place is definitely overpriced. But what else can you really expect when you walk into Westfield SF?
author: Leslie S.

description:
It's mall food. 

The service wasn't as bad as other people are mentioning but the sandwich was definitely overpriced for the size and quality of what I paid. However, the fries weren't bad. Expect long lines (especially during peak mall hours) and to be underwhelmed by what you receive after you order. But most of all, remember:

It's mall food.
author: Sean B.

description: Nothing exciting here. Not bad, not good. Tried the California Chicken which is grileld chicken, ranch and provolone. I guess if you're looking for a straightforward sandwich in the sea of food court options, it's not awful but there's just too many good places to make this any type of destination
author: Kim N.

description: I actually really liked my sub on multigrain with spicy asian bbq. Everything about it was spot on. The white american was a nice touch. Great fries too. Small sandwich was a perfect portii
author: Andrew K.

description:
Yeah it was good, sandwich hit the spot. Glad I got the small though. Fries were fresh and crispy but needed salt to taste.
Good for a food court
author: Mark N.

description:
Came here with a friend for a late dinner. As we looked at the menu, the friendly sample guy came up to us and offered a taste of their chicken california. 

Having just tasted the chicken california, we wanted something different.  After looking at the menu, we both ordered the philly chicken (sandwiches with mushrooms and/or avocados are definitely the most eye-catching for me hehe); original fries & lemonade for me while my friend got the bacon & cheese gourmet fries  and kiwi lemonade. 

We were both really satisfied with our orders. I definitely did not expect my piping hot fries!! Definitely burned myself a few times trying to eat it in the beginning. Haha =/  But that gives it an extra plus for me since it wasn't soggy or cold. It was full of crispy deliciousness. The sandwich was definitely filling and yummy. 

definitely a go-to place if i'm looking for a cheap, quick bite at the mall :)
author: Diana L.

description:
I got the Philly Cheesesteak and it was not good. The bread was like a hotdog bun= small. The meat was bland. 

Would not return.

Charley's Grilled sub... a sandwich place located in a mall. The lady in the front was giving out free samples. Tried one and decided to try a sandwich. The sandwiches came in what looks like 6 inch and a 12 inch choice. The cashier asks for condiments and veggies that you like in your sandwich. There isn't a huge choice, but having the choice of no mayo was pretty nice.

The turkey melt sandwich was nice and warm with a nice amount of meat to veggie ratio. The turkey meat were thinly sliced and they tasted pretty alright. The veggies were fresh and all warm from being heated up. It seems that they heat up the sandwich, but not really to a toasty point. Great if you want warm, but not crunchy sandwiches.

Overall, it's mall food. Lackluster sandwich, but it'll get you through the day. For a bit more money, you can find a better sandwich in this neighborhood.
author: Steven B.

description:
A new fast food Philly cheesesteak shop that opened up in the Westfield mall food court, today was the first time I had a chance to try it out.

I ordered the veggie philly sandwich and a side of fries and a strawberry lemonade.  My friend ordered the chicken philly.  He was a bit frustrated that he couldn't get any sides with it other than the fries, as the salad isn't a small side salad, but instead a large meal one.  A big minus there for anyone who's watching their carb count.  Since he couldn't get any sides he wanted, he ordered the large sandwich instead.

Second big minus: someone got confused and they ordered him a regular sized sandwich instead of the large.  We didn't notice until the sandwich came out and were both confused that it was the same size as my regular sized one.  He called over the guy who served it to him and was told "you might have ordered the large but you were charged for the regular, so that's what you get".  Not very customer-friendly if you ask me.  I know I heard him order the large, so it's a fault on them to get it wrong and not offer to fix it.  

Other than the mediocre customer service, the rest of the experience was good.  Our sandwiches were very fresh and tasty, including the bread that was so soft, you could pat your butt with it.  Seasoning salt for the fries is a definite happy bonus for me.  

Will probably go back again, since I really love grilled veggie sandwiches, but they better clean up their customer service and I'd suggest offering other side options instead of just fries for their combos.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I sampled their chicken sandwich and the bread was so yummy it hooked me in!..I ordered the Philly Cheese Steak and it was so disappointing. Past the good bread, the meat was so unflavored and dry! Bleh not eating there again. Fries were thick and ok.
author: Karen T.

description:
I was shopping downtown with ny girlfriend when we decided to drop by the food court for lunch. We usually are regulars at Buckhorn Grill, Couriander, and Bistro Burger but this time around, we decided to check out the new spot in the corner. 

At first glance, this place looks cool and appealing. We sampled a piece of the California Chicken Sandwich near the cashier and it was delicious. From this, we decided to eat here. There's a variety of sandwiches available to choose from that come in 7" or 12" rolls. I'm a fan of the traditional philly cheesesteak so I ordered a 12" philly cheesesteak and a gourmet side fries, cheddar bacon style, hoping to be ordering something similar to that of Aussie fries from Outback. My girlfriend opted for the chicken teriyaki sandwich when her turn came.

While waiting, I noticed an employee adding cheese to some French fries and handing it down to the next worker who added bits of bacon. It was then that I realized those were our cheddar bacon fries. Sadly, the cheddar being used was actually Macho cheese cheddar, not legit melted cheddar.

The quality of taste was very distinct in the fries when we finally got our order. The cheese tasted like melted nacho cheese, a very unpleasant taste in my opinion. The bacon was alright, but cold and overwhelming to my girlfriend who refused TL eat such bacon. Our sandwiches were a bit better. Although heavily filled with lettuce, we found the meat by gradually munching through the sandwich. The meat was thoroughly cooked and I could only taste a little provologne as I felt they were somewhat stingy with the cheese. Despite these small flaws, I downed the rest of the 12" sandwich down my throat and was satisfied. 

Charley's is more of a Great Steak sandwhich shop and way below that of the Cheesesteak Shop. Improvements can be made but its good enough to have for lunch a day where your feeling a sandwhich. But be wary of the nacho cheese doused cheddar bacon fries, because thats just not cool. Classic melted cheddar slices would do just fine. 

These false Aussie fries aside, the sandwiches taste good, but lack the authenticity or flavor as places such as Buckhorn or the Cheesesteak shop would have. Good job though Charleys Subs.
author: Jesus A.

description:
Worst. Cheesesteak. Ever.

For 4.99, you get about the same amount of meat in shredded form as a McDonalds one dollar Double Cheeseburger.

The fact that they call their cheesesteaks  "Philly" could not be more wrong. While most Philly Cheesesteaks are comprised of either provolone cheese or a cheese "whiz" of some variety, Charley's uses a white cheddar that looks like it came "fresh" from the individualized Kraft plastic wrappers.

The only positive was the bread, which seemed like it was a bit more fresh... only because it tasted like it wasn't fully cooked.

Stay away from this place as you will only leave hungry, and wishing you would have spent your hard earned money elsewhere.

It was so bad that it's actually what convinced me to join Yelp, just to write the above review.
author: Tyler B.

description:
I was surprised to see the low rating for this place! 
It definitely isn't that bad.... My friend and I decided to try this place after a long shopping trip. 
There was a pretty big selection of different sandwiches. We got the Philly Chicken and the Chicken California! Personally, I thought the best was the Chicken California. But that could just be because I'm a ranch lover. 
Neither sub was terrible though, and it really filled me up!
The subs were kind of expensive though, if you considered what you got for the price, but not SUPER expensive.
Anyways, for a location in a mall, it was pretty good!
author: Ashley N.

description:
The prices are comparable to Subways, the difference is that you get more meat than lettuce in your sandwich. Their Italian is really good.

It can be a bit of a hassle getting anything during the lunch the crowd, but that can happen at any place. So far I've had no trouble getting in and out at reasonable time.

The big bonuses for me is their combos and their lemonades. Their original combo (that includes a drink and regular fries) is only 3 bucks more. Their gourmet combo is 4, but that allows you to have a choice of any of their gourmet fries and can add a speciality lemonade.

Speaking of their specialty lemonades, they are the most yummies I've ever had. You can choose from having strawberry, peach, or blueberry. They use real fruit to infuse their drinks and it comes in a large cup.

The most I've spent getting a small sandwich (which is quite filling), the gourmet combo w/speciality lemonade, was $10.88.

Not a bad way to have lunch and it always smells great when someone brings it into the office,  even though that's kinda cruel.
author: Rachel N.

description:
Strawberry lemonade is delicious! However, make sure you ask for light ice, as they over fill it and it becomes really watery if you let it sit. . . And ask AS you order, not after because the workers give you attitude (it's not difficult to pour out ice and isn't costly). 
I enjoy their samples, they're they biggest out of all the food places in the food court.
author: Emerald I.

description: This review is for their lemonade only. It's amazing. Real pieces of fruit... So refreshing. Love it.
author: Nina X.

description:
The small cheesesteak with fries and a drink cost about $10 which - in my opinion - is above average compared to other sandwich/cheesesteak places I ate before.

They had a sizing chart and I asked if the sizes in the picture were accurate. They told me that they are 1:1, but after I ordered a "small" it turned out to be smaller than in the picture (same length, but the bread was narrower). A thin layer of meat only covered about half of the bread, half of the meat was covered with a thin layer of melted cheese, two thin half slices of tomato and a few pieces of lettuce - that was it. There were not many fries, some had either burn marks or were soggy. Wow!

I was hungry again after about an hour. That was my first and last time eating at Charley's. Up to you if you want to give it a try, but I would not recommend it.
author: Tep M.

description:
I came here with a friend to get a thirst quenching peach lemonade, which I was kind of excited about. There were also sooo many people coming just to order lemonade.  One would think that's a good sign, but no...

The peach lemonade was very disappointing, which is sad because it had a lot of potential.  Disappoint number one, there was way to much ice, which made the drink very watered down.  Disappoint number two, there wasn't enough peach flavoring.  There wasn't even a strong lemonade flavor!  And for lemonade I like to feel like I'm drinking lemonade.  

If you decide to get lemonade here, I would recommend asking for little or no ice.  I think that would easily solve the entire flavor issue.  It also could've been a bad day for me to get lemonade.  For one lemonade it was about $3.25, including tax.
author: Samantha S.

description: Terrible sandwich. The chicken is of a poor quality, with a chewy consistency. The "sauce" was boring and bland. Do not eat here.
author: Captain B.

description: Not bad at all!  I had a small chicken philly & a small fries for $5.99!  Chicken philly is warm & meaty so it's quite satisfying.  The fries are burning hot & crispy which is exactly what I like!  Got fast & courteous service.  It is a pleasant surprise!
author: Angela Y.

description:
Overpriced. Saw the $4.99 small sandwich and thought I'd spend a little less at the mall. 

Small is either 4" long or 4" less than regular. Either way too tiny and overpriced. 

They forgot the mushrooms and onions and it was oversalted. Worse $7 I've spent at the mall. 

Go to Buckhorn
author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.

description: Pretty good actually. I'm not the biggest fan of melts but I must say I enjoyed mine from Charley's Grilled Subs.
author: Diego A.

description:
First strike for this place is that they don't give the SFSU discount. SFSU's downtown campus is located in the mall, and as such students and staff of SFSU get a discount in most food places in the mall. However, this place is one of the exceptions. Lame.

I ordered a philly cheesesteak combo, and I was not impressed. It was mostly bread, lettuce and tomato with not a whole lot of meat. The taste was ok, but nothing spectacular. The fries were good, but it wasn't a whole lot for the order.

All in all I spent about $12 for a mediocre sandwich, which was mostly bread, a small order of fries, and a lot of Diet Coke (thank God for free refills.) Disappointing because I can go to Buckhorn Grill, a few stalls away, and get a huge sandwich (loaded with meat), a bigger portion of fries, and a lot of Diet Coke (free refills too) for about $10 using my SFSU discount.
author: Tonichi L.

description:
Missing two standard Philly cheesesteak ingredients: cheese and oil.

The later is available if you want it. I did not. The former might be available if you want it, but as far as I can tell it does not come standard.

Chicken. Onions. Bell peppers. Roll. No excess oil.

Thank you.
author: Jason B.

description: I took Philly Chicken (with grilled onions, green peppers, mushrooms, provolone cheese). It was very good, but calories is higher than Subway's Veggie Delite sub (517 vs 230).....
author: A J.

description:
My friend told me about this place so I thought I'd give it a try. This place was so bad. It was expensive being that it's a fast food place. They were really slow maybe cause the guy who was putting the finishing touches on the sandwhich messed up half the sandwhiches.( older asian man with glasses) the person who served me my food was nice but in a rush to get the orders out that had to be remade.


My sandwhich the Philly chicken was good. The fries were okay the lemonade was way too sweet for my liking. 

Overall: 

I'll give this place 1star. 

My advice for this place is for the manager to have more people working. The wait for the food is crazy 6-10 mins is crazy for a wait time. And if they are going to have someone finish off the sandwhich please make sure it's someone who knows what they are doing. Unlike the Asian man!!!!!

Other then that good luck! And I hope you fix the problems
author: Mia C.

description: I like this place more than Great Steak that's usually in every mall.  I like this place more than Philly's on Geneva.  Its def less greasy and much more satisfying.  The fries could be vamped up some, but I will continue to come when I am in the area and get my cheese steak fix :)
author: Alice E.

description: Charley's  food tastes good. I suggest that if you order food from this location that you eat it there. I ordered food to go a few days ago for three people and  the toppings were all wrong.  I told the cashier what toppings I wanted in each sandwich. Since I ordered to go i expected it to be correct but when I got home the sandwiches were not labeled so i had to open them all to figure out what was what. Than one sandwich had all the toppings I did not want  and the other two sandwiches did not have the toppings i requested. If the sandwich makers are not going to follow  peoples sandwich toppings choices  than they should not offer it. If I had ordered that food to eat at the mall I would have caught their  errors.  On the bright side they do have a sandwich member card where you get a free sandwich after a certain amount of sandwiches.
author: Guadalupe G.

description: Im assuming that everyone that had something to say is from the east coast r PHILLY!!! Cause the sandwhich I had was so good and tasty and they get a plus for soft bread ill be going back
author: Shana E.

description: The only place I have ever eaten where I almost had to toss the food away after one bite. What they serve is a pretty close match to airline food from the 80s...
author: Matthew S.

description: And the sign says Since 1983 or some sh*t. What does that mean? Since 1983 you been serving bad food. Do not promote cheese steak unless you know how to make it.. It's just meat on a sandwich with no cheese. I had a drips of cheese on my so called philly. Then I started feeling sick after eating it. Might I add your lemon aide taste like sugar water. I should have ate the japanese food next to it...
author: mrhustler h.

description: Quite possibly the worst food I have eaten at any shopping mall anywhere. The fries were undercooked and cold. The Italian Hero came slathered in MAYO, which does not belong on an Italian sandwich, after I had specifically requested to hold it. They'll be lucky to last ninety days
author: James L.

description: Not the best cheesesteak I've had, by a LONG shot. Before I came here, I never knew that a cheesesteak could be less than perfect. Not saying that my bacon+3 cheese cheesesteak wasn't delicious, it just wasn't as good as any other cheesesteak i've had before, and far far far overpriced for what I got (a small sandwich with not too much filling, a small bowl of fries, and a soda, for $11).
author: Melody L.

description: Stopped here for quick food while shopping, and it was probably the best sandwich I've ever had! I don't remember what it was called, but it had chicken and lettuce in it..very flavorful and the bread was delicious as well! My friend got the bacon cheddar ranch fries, and though they would probably kill you after having too many, they were amazing!
author: Jaclyn C.

description: first let me say that I love The Cheese steak shop on Divisadero. This is a major dissapointment to call this a cheese steak, although it does have cheese and steak. I ordered the deluxe as did Elaine in a prior post. The bread was very soft and tasty, 4 stars. The filling was meager and bland although not bad just bland 2 stars. I only ordered a side of fries and drink due to the cost of the loaded fries, way overpriced imho. Fries were ok 3 stars. The lemonade was warm as was the kiwi lemonade, I finished it before the ice had a chance to have effect. Would I go back? No, there are better choices inside the mall.
author: Mark S.

description: Sorry, but this had to be the most unamazing cheesesteak I've ever had. Blah. Regrets. Etc.
author: Maximillian M.

description: i'm a fan of the buffalo chicken when i'm feeling like eating something greasy in a jif. and the cheddar bacon fries are deadly too. yummo. but i won't complain if they up the flavor..
author: laura f.

description: Typical food-court stop. I actually can't comment on much of the menu, but the bacon/cheese fries were great! The staff was friendly and the fries made for a nice snack break.
author: Clay G.

description: My girlfriend and I were at union square and got super hungry after all the walking so we decided we wanted to eat somewhere that served quick but good food. we ended up going to westffield mall and looked around the different options they had in the food court. we were caught between Buckhorn Grill or Charley's Grilled Subs. we chose Charley's because they had so many options of sandwiches for a decent price and sizes. I got the Bacon 3 Cheese Steak and my girlfriend got the combo Philly Cheese Steak with a side of cheddar and bacon fries, and a glass of lemonade. The sandwiches were a bit dry but the fries surely made up for it. the fries were so delicious, the best part of the meal. The amount of food we got was perfect and made us go to a food coma for a bit. me and my girlfriend  definitely love this place.
author: Marcello B.

description: I've had the Philly Steak Deluxe , Chicken Buffalo , and Chicken California sandwiches from here . The Philly Steak Deluxe was horrible ... it lacked flavor and I felt like the sandwich was missing something very important ( besides the flavor of course) . The Chicken Buffalo was pretty good ... the buffalo sauce had a little kick in it . The Chicken California tasted pretty good too ... the chicken was very delicious and went very well with the ranch sauce . I've had their gourmet fries with cheese , ranch , and bacon ... it wasn't that crackin' . I actually felt like their regular fries tasted better . Their regular fries taste alright whereas their gourmet fries tastes kinda weird . Their raspberry lemonade is alright but way too sweet . I'm glad they made a sandwich shop in the mall .
author: Eileen L.

description: This took the spot where Jodi Maroni's used to be - the menu is almost like The Great Steak & Fry minus the baked potatoes. I ordered a regular (small) size deluxe cheesesteak sub (steak, cheese, onions, peppers, and mushrooms...you can opt to add in lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo) with a side of ultimate fries (the toppings I chose were cheese and bacon), and a drink. Being that the fries and drink were nearly $5 extra, I expected a huge portion. The sandwich was a good size for a small and was delicious...tender slices of steak with no gristle. I also asked for no mayo and glad I did because the melted cheese inside was more than enough. The fries though were a big disappointment. Perfectly cooked fries, but for $4-$5 extra (small order), I was surprised to see how meager  the cheese and bacon were added. Perhaps two squirts of cheese and I counted exactly eight bacon bits. Really comical for something that they call "ultimate fries". Pile it on people!!!
author: Elaine W.

description: I had a chicken and bacon sub ordered without cheese.  They gave me cheese, though I ate it anyway though I certainly will not be back.  The fries were not that great either.  Even the guy taking orders seemed indifferent.
author: Fred T.

description: I've been to other Charley's Grilled Subs around the US, and I have to say that by far, this one was the worst. After my first bad experience here, I decided to give them a second chance, but that was the last one. The cashier was rude, he didn't even ask what condiments or size I wanted for my sub, he didn't even asked me if I wanted it for here or to go and when I told him that I wanted it to go he rolled his eyes...WTF? And then I had to wait for about 30 minutes to get my food..and of course, not only did they get my order wrong, but they served it to me on a tray, so I told the lady that I asked for it to go. She also rolled her eyes at me and was talking crap about me with the cashier who got it wrong...I was about to flip out, but instead I just got my sandwich and left, and decided not to ever go back there. The food wasn't bad, but I just wished they got my order correctly and that they were a bit nicer since it's their job to deal with the costumers.
author: Ange B.
